abstract: The markets fell as the violence in Libya picked up, affecting shares of industries like Caterpillar that are heavily dependent on the economic recovery.
snippet: The markets fell as the violence in Libya picked up, affecting shares of industries like Caterpillar that are heavily dependent on the economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: Stocks fell on Wednesday, sending the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index lower a third time in four days amid concern about escalating violence in Libya.

headline.main: Shares Decline as Violence in Libya Weighs on Markets
headline.print_headline: Shares Decline as Violence In Libya Weighs on Markets
